description: An XML-based format for editable textual documents, usually with .odt as file extension. Part of the OpenDocument Format (ODF) family.  Documented in ODF 1.1 specification.  Component files are packaged using a constrained version of the ZIP format.  Incorporates an XML-based manifest file to list component files.

relations.title: Sustainability of Digital Formats: Planning for Library of Congress Collections

name: OpenDocument Text Document Format (ODT), Version 1.1.  Part of OASIS Open Document Format for Office Applications, Version 1.1 and the equivalent ISO/IEC 26300:2006.
